intro: Lecaniodiscus cupanioides, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the deserts of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, a common adaptation for reducing water loss in arid environments. Lecaniodiscus cupanioides is well-suited for xeriscaping and requires minimal water once established.
